q: Town& Country and Dodge Grand Caravan are built. Sergio Marchionne didn't give many specifics about the new vans, but the executive did note the next van would be a different type of people mover. In previous reports, Sergio Marchionne also suggested one of the two brands currently selling minivans may receive a smaller, more car-like people mover( think Ford's new C-Max) in lieu of a traditional van design.

This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit," said Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat. Alan Mulally said Ford has learned that it has to deal with the current reality. You have to match production to real demand and accelerate development of new products that people will want to buy, he said. For Ford that meant going with a plan for massive restructuring to a consortium of banks and borrowing$ 23.5 billion, Alan Mulally said. For GM and Chrysler it meant bankruptcy filings

, DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Larry Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's PageLarry PagereplacesEric SchmidtEric Schmidtasceoofgoogleinternetreacts6650/39756427/SIG=15887p9lt/*http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/01/update- from- chairman.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+blogspot%2FMKuf+%28Official+Google+Blog%29" blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" in reference to his PageLarry PagereplacesEric SchmidtEric Schmidtasceoofgoogleinternetreacts6650/39756427/SIG=11vpslch7/*http://www.amazon.com/Googled-End-World-As-Know/dp/1594202354" much-discussed

make room for co-founder Larry Page , a role he will start in on April 4th. "In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly," wrote Eric Schmidt . I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry Page will be even better! Larry Page , in my clear opinion, is ready to lead.
